title: Poetry and Figurative Language

vocab.definition: Language that uses words in creative ways to create vivid images and meanings
Giving human qualities to non-human things
An extreme exaggeration used for emphasis or effect
Words that imitate the sounds they represent
The pattern of stressed and unstressed syllables in poetry

teachingNotes: Read poems aloud to emphasize rhythm and sound. Practice identifying different types of figurative language. Encourage students to write their own poems using these devices.

sample.question: What do we call giving human qualities to non-human things?

choices: I'm so tired I could sleep forever.
expectedAny: I'm so tired I could sleep forever

sample.question: Language that uses words creatively is ________ language.

truefalse.question: 'The thunder roared angrily' is an example of personification.
'I'm so hungry I could eat a horse' is literal.
Rhythm is the pattern of sounds in poetry.
Figurative language always means exactly what it says.
'The stars danced' gives human qualities to stars.
